reviews.review_msg: Gem of a teacher. Truely cares for his students and passionate about Chemistry. Engaging lecturer and funny sense of humour.

Dr Williams is a great prof. Even if the lecture material got boring at times, he used his dry humor to get us all through it. Labs were forgiving, i.e. I accidentally dumped my final product down the sink, yet still got 75% on the lab report. Assignments are time consuming but help boost your grade. Tests were fair.
Vance was a great prof, very clear on what's needed to be understood and known in the class. He gives out practice problems makes sure you understand those.

Great prof. Super chill, very helpful in office hours. His practice problems and exams are the key to success... do those, ask about them in office hours if you don't get it, and you'll be prepared for exams. Lecture pace is nice and he goes through examples there. Lab is chill. Textbook unnecessary, but might want to review 281/283 a bit.

Dr.Williams is a great chem prof, much easier than Dr.Merbouh, so I would highly recommend him if you need 380 for a Chem minor or major. He is incredibly helpful during office hours, lectures are pretty solid. Also, plenty of hints and practice questions for his exams, and the practice exams are very similar to the actual exams, which is nice.
Great professor, laid back and easy to approach with questions. The only problem was that the lectures were not very indepth and I was hoping more material would be covered.

an alright prof, pretty friendly and easy to get along with. lec can be boring so prepare to do some self learning. midterms are ok. assignments and lab reports are fine as long as you have friends who get whats going on. gives lot of extensions=)
good notes; explain things well; and easy marking

After he tested students on material we were not taught, majority of class failed and his attitude towards students flipped. He was rude and made fun of students for asking questions. I learned a lot from him but I know I deserved a better grade.

It's like one day a rugby player drank a bottle of Francium and was granted with chemistry powers by the science gods but ended up with a fatal weakness for students' ignorance and thus to quench his thirst for justice must destroy said students with extended rants. If you work hard though your sacrifice will appease him and he might let you live.
EXTREMELY RUDE to some students. Picks favourites in class. Has a manger issue as well. Avoid at all cost.

merbouh is a great prof. he is really there for the students - he wants you to learn and be successful and committed to CHEmistry - but he also expeCts you to do the hard worK and practice. this is probably the Most fun class i've taken. it's "tetris with functional groups" as nabYl likes to say. Best cLass/cOurse, Great prof.

Goes to extremes to try to get you interested and working on the subject matter.  Gave us a not-for-mark 'quiz' the first day that had an average of 20%.  Regardless, the exams and teaching style are straight-forward, with 75% of the questions coming from the text book.  Pay attention, think before you speak, and you'll do fine.  Would take again.

At first, was scared of this guy fro all the hype, but he ended up as an awesome teacher. I look forward to this class every week. He may be a hard ass, but half the time he doesn't even mean it. 282 is hard with any prof, but definately take 380 with Dr. Merbouh. (He didn't yell at us  at all...it's all hype!)
What the hell is wrong with this professor! He should not teach. I recommend that you take the course at the Surrey campus. Simply, he is the worse at SFU.

he is a nice guy. awesome person to chat about anything with. he's got a very down to earth personality. very real. it's a pleasure to have around in chem department. very approachable. great music collection!

One of the best profs i have ever had. I could understand where some of the other comments were coming from but that is his method. He is always approachable, always ready to help you learn, But don't go to him unprepared expecting him to reteach you everything, he'll throw you out of his office! All in all I have learned the most from his class.

Lecture material is clearly organized and is quite informative. I DID learn quite a bit of useful spectroscopy in this course. However, his marking is quite hard and you can lose a lot of marks quite easily for what would be minor mistakes in other courses. Lab material has become tougher since I took the course, so I can't comment on that.

A great teacher- he made a potentially very difficult subject straightforward and very approachable.  He  wants students to do well and understand the concepts. A really good prof. Just be sure to show initiative in his class and do your homework- a lot of exam problems come from the book.

worst prof ever!! he will yell the crap out of you so be awared!! personally i don't like his pushy style of teaching. He will throw you a bunch of unoticed quizzes which you will fail if you r taking other courses at the same time,or may be you can ace them if you wanna fail the other courses. He will eventually give u an A when u r tired to death

Great teacher. Straight forward, clear notes that are well related to text book. Gives tons of examples. Exams are extremely fair, if not easy.  
 Do all practice problems in text to get A. He doesn't expect too much, but do know basic chemistry(functional groups). Avoid asking stupid questions, he gets very aggitated. Be prepared before seeing him
